entities.name: Bensalem Island
entities.definition: Isolated island polity governing through laws of secrecy, knowing most of habitable world while remaining unknown

evidence.quote: We of this island of Bensalem, have this; that by means of our solitary situation; and of the laws of secrecy, which we have for our travellers, and our rare admission of strangers; we know well most part of the habitable world, and are ourselves unknown

entities.name: Salomon's House
entities.definition: Scientific college whose end is knowledge of causes and secret motions, enlarging bounds of human empire to effect all things possible

evidence.quote: The end of our foundation is the knowledge of causes, and secret motions of things; and the enlarging of the bounds of human empire, to the effecting of all things possible

entities.name: Merchants of Light
entities.definition: Twelve fellows sailing to foreign countries under concealed names to bring books, abstracts, and patterns of experiments

evidence.quote: We have twelve that sail into foreign countries, under the names of other nations, (for our own we conceal); who bring us the books, and abstracts, and patterns of experiments of all other parts. These we call Merchants of Light

entities.name: Interpreters of Nature
entities.definition: Three fellows who raise former discoveries by experiments into greater observations, axioms, and aphorisms

evidence.quote: Lastly, we have three that raise the former discoveries by experiments into greater observations, axioms, and aphorisms. These we call Interpreters of Nature

entities.name: Feast of the Family
entities.definition: Bensalem ceremony honoring fathers of thirty living descendants with state funding and patriarchal authority

evidence.quote: There is not under the heavens so chaste a nation as this of Bensalem; nor so free from all pollution or foulness. It is the virgin of the world

entities.name: William Rawley
entities.definition: Bacon's chaplain, friend, literary executor who published New Atlantis posthumously in 1627 with Sylva Sylvarum

evidence.quote: a fable my lord devised, to the end that he might exhibit therein a model or description of a college, instituted for the interpretation of nature

entities.name: Oxford Francis Bacon Project
entities.definition: Major scholarly project producing new critical edition to replace Victorian Spedding edition with modern editorial techniques

evidence.quote: Volume XIV of the Oxford Francis Bacon is comprised of Bacon's last natural historical and literary writings, the Sylva sylvarum, New Atlantis, and Magnalia Naturae

entities.name: David Colclough
entities.definition: Professor of Renaissance Studies, editor of New Atlantis in OFB XIX providing detailed introduction and critical apparatus

evidence.quote: David Colclough's detailed Introduction sets New Atlantis in the contexts of Bacon's works and of contemporary models of information-gathering and -management

morphisms.statement: Salomon's House serves as the very eye and lanthorn of the kingdom of Bensalem

evidence.quote: which house, or college (my good brethren) is the very eye of this kingdom

morphisms.statement: Rawley posthumously published and explained Bacon's model of scientific college

evidence.quote: a fable my lord devised, to the end that he might exhibit therein a model or description of a college, instituted for the interpretation of nature

morphisms.statement: Oxford project produces Colclough edition as part of comprehensive scholarly series

evidence.quote: Volume XIV of the Oxford Francis Bacon... Edited by the late Graham Rees with Maria Wakely, and including extensive commentary by David Colclough

morphisms.statement: Merchants of Light gather raw materials ultimately synthesized by Interpreters of Nature

evidence.quote: We have twelve that sail into foreign countries... Lastly, we have three that raise the former discoveries by experiments into greater observations, axioms, and aphorisms

morphisms.statement: Salomon's House scientific program parallels Bensalem's social reproduction through family ceremonies

evidence.quote: New Atlantis: A Worke unfinished, it was appended to (i.e. twinned with) a larger work, Sylva Sylvarum

olog.name: Bacon's New Atlantis: Epistemic and Rhetorical Inheritance

axioms: Systematic foreign collection enables domestic synthesis of natural knowledge
Collaborative institutional research surpasses individual philosophical inquiry
Scientific secrecy balances public benefit with institutional preservation
Hierarchical division of scientific labor optimizes knowledge production efficiency
Institutional isolation preserves scientific integrity from external political corruption

tier_c_editorial_reception.description: Rawley → OFB XIX → Colclough → Modern Readings
axioms: Editorial apparatus mediates between historical text and contemporary scholarly interpretation
Critical editions transform textual authority through modern scholarly intervention

rules: IF foreign knowledge is systematically collected THEN domestic scientific synthesis becomes possible
IF experiments are methodically organized by offices THEN axioms and aphorisms emerge
IF scientific institutions maintain secrecy THEN external independence is preserved
IF editorial projects recontextualize historical texts THEN new interpretive possibilities arise

evidence.quote: The end of our foundation is the knowledge of causes, and secret motions of things; and the enlarging of the bounds of human empire, to the effecting of all things possible
we have consultations, which of the inventions and experiences which we have discovered shall be published, and which not: and take all an oath of secrecy
Volume XIV of the Oxford Francis Bacon is comprised of Bacon's last natural historical and literary writings

variants.description: EEBO 1658 vs later editions: EEBO TCP access failed, preventing comparison of early vs modern witness variants
variants.missing_comparison: Early Rawley preface phrasing vs Gutenberg modernization

omissions: TLS Houston review inaccessible - missing modern reception analysis of Bacon's technocratic legacy
Colclough Ethics and Politics chapter unavailable - missing secondary scholarly interpretation
OFB XIX preview content limited - missing detailed editorial principles and copy-text information
overreach: May infer systematic twinning relationship between Sylva Sylvarum and New Atlantis without full editorial evidence
Could suggest editorial causation in interpretation without direct textual warrant for influence claims

corrections.fix: Add entity for 'Sylva Sylvarum' with twins_with relation to New Atlantis based on FBRT evidence of paired publication
corrections.replacement_quote: New Atlantis: A Worke unfinished, it was appended to (i.e. twinned with) a larger work, Sylva Sylvarum

corrections.fix: Include morphism for 'King Solamona' governs 'Bensalem' with institutional founding evidence
corrections.replacement_quote: There reigned in this land, about nineteen hundred years ago, a king, whose memory of all others we most adore; not superstitiously, but as a divine instrument, though a mortal man; his name was Solamona

corrections.fix: Expand axiom about selective publication with oath of secrecy evidence for institutional governance
corrections.replacement_quote: we have consultations, which of the inventions and experiences which we have discovered shall be published, and which not: and take all an oath of secrecy, for the concealing of those which we think fit to keep secret
